00022 #include "dfsch/lib/extref.h"
00023 #include <dfsch/number.h>
00024 #include <pthread.h>
00025 #include <stdint.h>

00032 static uint32_t instance_id[4];
00033 static int instance_id_set = 0;
00034 static uint64_t serial = 0;
00035 static pthread_mutex_t serial_mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
00036 static pthread_mutex_t extref_mutex = PTHREAD_MUTEX_INITIALIZER;
00037 
00038 typedef struct extref_t extref_t;
00039 struct extref_t {
00040   uint32_t uniqid[3];
00041   time_t timeout;
00042   time_t valid_to;
00043   int mode;
00044   dfsch_object_t* object;
00045   extref_t* next;
00046 };
00047 
00048 static extref_t** extrefs;
00049 static size_t extref_mask = 0;
00050 static size_t extref_count = 0;
00051 static time_t extref_next_gc;
00052 
00053 static void extref_resize();
00054 
00055 static void* extref_gc_thread(void* ignore){
00056   time_t cur_time;
00057 
00058   while (1){
00059     sleep(2);
00060     cur_time = time(NULL);
00061     while (cur_time < extref_next_gc){
00062       printf(";; GC thread sleeping for %d seconds\n", extref_next_gc - cur_time);
00063       sleep(extref_next_gc - cur_time);
00064       cur_time = time(NULL);
00065     }
00066 
00067     pthread_mutex_lock(&extref_mutex);
00068     extref_resize();
00069     pthread_mutex_unlock(&extref_mutex);
00070   }
00071 }
00072 
00073 static extref_t* extref_get(uint32_t uniqid[3]){
00074   extref_t* i;
00075 
00076   if (extref_mask == 0 || extref_count == 0){
00077     return NULL;
00078   }
00079 
00080   pthread_mutex_lock(&extref_mutex);
00081 
00082   i = extrefs[uniqid[0] & extref_mask];
00083 
00084   while (i){
00085     if (memcmp(i->uniqid, uniqid, sizeof(uint32_t)*3) == 0){
00086       pthread_mutex_unlock(&extref_mutex);
00087       return i;
00088     }
00089     i = i->next;
00090   }
00091   pthread_mutex_unlock(&extref_mutex);
00092   return NULL;
00093 }
00094 
00095 static void extref_init(){
00096   pthread_t thread;
00097   extrefs = GC_MALLOC(sizeof(extref_t*)*256);
00098   extref_mask = 255;
00099   extref_next_gc = time(NULL) + 60; 
00100   memset(extrefs, 0, sizeof(extref_t*)*256);
00101   pthread_create(&thread, NULL, extref_gc_thread, NULL);
00102   pthread_detach(thread);
00103 }
00104 
00105 static void extref_put(extref_t* new){
00106   pthread_mutex_lock(&extref_mutex);
00107   if (extref_mask == 0){
00108     extref_init();
00109   }
00110 
00111   extref_count++;
00112   new->next = extrefs[new->uniqid[0] & extref_mask];
00113   extrefs[new->uniqid[0] & extref_mask] = new;
00114 
00115   if (extref_count > extref_mask){
00116     extref_resize();
00117   }
00118 
00119   pthread_mutex_unlock(&extref_mutex);
00120 }
00121 
00122 static void extref_resize(){
00123   size_t i;
00124   extref_t* j;
00125   extref_t* k;
00126   time_t cur_time;
00127   extref_t** new_extrefs;
00128   size_t new_mask;
00129   
00130   printf(";; resizing extrefs\n;;(");
00131   for (i = 0; i <= extref_mask; i++){
00132     printf("%p ", extrefs[i]);
00133   }
00134   printf(")\n");
00135 
00136 
00137   cur_time = time(NULL);
00138   extref_count = 0;
00139 
00140   for (i = 0; i <= extref_mask; i++){
00141     j = extrefs[i];
00142     printf(";;; %p\n", j);
00143     while (j && j->valid_to < cur_time){
00144       printf(";;; %p->%p\n", j, j->next);
00145       j = j->next;
00146     }
00147     extrefs[i] = j;
00148     while (j) {
00149       printf(";;; %p->%p\n", j, j->next);
00150       if (j->valid_to < cur_time){
00151         k->next = j->next;
00152       } else {
00153         k = j;
00154         extref_count++;
00155         if (j->valid_to < extref_next_gc || extref_next_gc < cur_time){
00156           extref_next_gc = j->valid_to;
00157         } 
00158       }
00159       j = j->next;
00160     }
00161   }
00162 
00163   if (extref_next_gc < cur_time){
00164     extref_next_gc = cur_time + 30;
00165   }
00166 
00167   printf(";;; %d live references found\n", extref_count);
00168   printf(";;; GC cycle due in %d seconds\n", extref_next_gc - cur_time);
00169 
00170 
00171   if (extref_count > extref_mask){
00172     new_mask = ((extref_mask + 1) * 2) - 1;
00173     printf(";;; Grow to %d \n", new_mask);
00174   } else if (extref_count < extref_mask/2 && extref_mask > 255) {
00175     new_mask = ((extref_mask + 1) / 2) - 1;
00176     printf(";;; Shrink to %d \n", new_mask);
00177   } else {
00178     return;
00179   }
00180 
00181   new_extrefs = GC_MALLOC(sizeof(extref_t*) * (new_mask + 1));
00182   memset(new_extrefs, 0, sizeof(extref_t*) * (new_mask + 1));
00183 
00184   for (i = 0; i <= extref_mask; i++){
00185     j = extrefs[i];
00186     while (j) {
00187       k = j->next;
00188       j->next = new_extrefs[j->uniqid[0] & new_mask];
00189       new_extrefs[j->uniqid[0] & new_mask] = j;
00190       printf(";; (setf (elt new %d) %p)\n", j->uniqid[0] & new_mask, j);
00191       j = k;
00192     }
00193   }
00194 
00195   extref_mask = new_mask;
00196   extrefs = new_extrefs;
00197 }

00202 static int idchar_value(char ch){
00203   if ((ch >= 'A') && (ch <= 'Z')){
00204     return ch - 'A';
00205   } else if ((ch >= 'a') && (ch <= 'z')){
00206     return ch - 'a' + 26;
00207   } else if ((ch >= '0') && (ch <= '9')){
00208     return ch - '0' + 52;
00209   } else if (ch == '.'){
00210     return 62;
00211   } else if (ch == '-'){
00212     return 63;
00213   }
00214   return -1;
00215 }
00216 static const char id_chars[] = 
00217   "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789.-";
00218 
00219 static uint64_t get_serial(){
00220   uint64_t ret;
00221   pthread_mutex_lock(&serial_mutex);
00222   ret = serial;
00223   serial++;
00224   pthread_mutex_unlock(&serial_mutex);
00225   return ret;
00226 }
00227 
00228 static void extref_init_instance_id(){
00229   uint32_t buf[4];
00230   int fd;
00231 
00232   instance_id[0] = getpid();
00233   instance_id[1] = time(NULL);
00234   instance_id[2] = 0;
00235   instance_id[3] = 0;
00236 
00237   fd = open("/dev/urandom", O_RDONLY);
00238   if (fd < 0){
00239     fd = open("/dev/random", O_RDONLY);
00240   }
00241   if (fd >= 0){
00242     instance_id[2] = fd;
00243     read(fd, &buf, sizeof(buf));
00244     instance_id[0] ^= buf[0];
00245     instance_id[1] ^= buf[1];
00246     instance_id[2] ^= buf[2];
00247     instance_id[3] ^= buf[2];
00248     close (fd);
00249   }
00250 }
00251 
00252 static void create_uniq_id(uint32_t uid[3]){
00253   int i;
00254   uint32_t sum=0, delta=0x9E3779B9;
00255   uint64_t serial;
00256   char* ret;
00257 
00258   serial = get_serial();
00259 
00260   uid[0] = serial >> 32;
00261   uid[1] = serial;
00262   uid[2] = 0;
00263   
00264   if (!instance_id_set){
00265     extref_init_instance_id();
00266     instance_id_set = 1;
00267   }
00268 
00269   for(i=0; i<32; i++) {
00270     uid[0] += ((uid[1] << 4 ^ uid[1] >> 5) + uid[1]) 
00271       ^ (sum + instance_id[sum & 3]);
00272     sum += delta;
00273     uid[1] += ((uid[0] << 4 ^ uid[0] >> 5) + uid[0]) 
00274       ^ (sum + instance_id[sum>>11 & 3]);
00275   }
00276   for(i=0; i<32; i++) {
00277     uid[2] += ((uid[1] << 4 ^ uid[1] >> 5) + uid[1])
00278       ^ (sum + instance_id[sum & 3]);
00279     sum += delta;
00280     uid[1] += ((uid[2] << 4 ^ uid[2] >> 5) + uid[2]) 
00281       ^ (sum + instance_id[sum>>11 & 3]);
00282   }
00283 
00284 }
00285 
00286 static char* encode_uniqid(uint32_t uniqid[3]){
00287   uint32_t v0, v1, v2, v3;
00288   char* ret = GC_MALLOC_ATOMIC(17);
00289 
00290   v0 = uniqid[0];
00291   v1 = uniqid[1];
00292   v2 = uniqid[2];
00293   v3 = ((v0 & 0xff000000) >> 8) | 
00294     ((v1 & 0xff000000) >> 16) | 
00295     (v2 & 0xff000000) >> 24;
00296 
00297   ret = GC_MALLOC_ATOMIC(17);
00298   ret[0] = id_chars[(v0 >> 18) & 0x3f];
00299   ret[1] = id_chars[(v0 >> 12) & 0x3f];
00300   ret[2] = id_chars[(v0 >> 6) & 0x3f];
00301   ret[3] = id_chars[(v0 >> 0) & 0x3f];
00302 
00303   ret[4] = id_chars[(v1 >> 18) & 0x3f];
00304   ret[5] = id_chars[(v1 >> 12) & 0x3f];
00305   ret[6] = id_chars[(v1 >> 6) & 0x3f];
00306   ret[7] = id_chars[(v1 >> 0) & 0x3f];
00307 
00308   ret[8] = id_chars[(v2 >> 18) & 0x3f];
00309   ret[9] = id_chars[(v2 >> 12) & 0x3f];
00310   ret[10] = id_chars[(v2 >> 6) & 0x3f];
00311   ret[11] = id_chars[(v2 >> 0) & 0x3f];
00312 
00313   ret[12] = id_chars[(v3 >> 18) & 0x3f];
00314   ret[13] = id_chars[(v3 >> 12) & 0x3f];
00315   ret[14] = id_chars[(v3 >> 6) & 0x3f];
00316   ret[15] = id_chars[(v3 >> 0) & 0x3f];
00317   ret[16] = 0;
00318 
00319   return ret;
00320 }
00321 static int decode_uniqid(uint32_t uniqid[3], char* str){
00322   uint32_t v3;
00323   int i;
00324 
00325   if (strlen(str)!=16){
00326     return 0;
00327   }
00328 
00329   for (i = 0; i < 16; i++){
00330     if (idchar_value(str[i]) == -1){
00331       return 0;
00332     }
00333   }
00334 
00335   uniqid[0] = (idchar_value(str[0]) << 18)
00336     | (idchar_value(str[1]) << 12)
00337     | (idchar_value(str[2]) << 6)
00338     | (idchar_value(str[3]) << 0);
00339 
00340   uniqid[1] = (idchar_value(str[4]) << 18)
00341     | (idchar_value(str[5]) << 12)
00342     | (idchar_value(str[6]) << 6)
00343     | (idchar_value(str[7]) << 0);
00344 
00345   uniqid[2] = (idchar_value(str[8]) << 18)
00346     | (idchar_value(str[9]) << 12)
00347     | (idchar_value(str[10]) << 6)
00348     | (idchar_value(str[11]) << 0);
00349 
00350   v3 = (idchar_value(str[12]) << 18)
00351     | (idchar_value(str[13]) << 12)
00352     | (idchar_value(str[14]) << 6)
00353     | (idchar_value(str[15]) << 0);
00354 
00355   uniqid[0] |= (v3 << 8) & 0xff000000;
00356   uniqid[1] |= (v3 << 16) & 0xff000000;
00357   uniqid[2] |= (v3 << 24) & 0xff000000;
00358 
00359   return 1;
00360 }

00362 
00363 char* dfsch_extref_create(dfsch_object_t* object, time_t timeout, int mode){
00364   extref_t* er = GC_MALLOC(sizeof(extref_t));
00365   create_uniq_id(er->uniqid);
00366   er->timeout = timeout;
00367   er->mode = mode;
00368   er->valid_to = time(NULL) + timeout;
00369   er->object = object;
00370 
00371   extref_put(er);
00372   
00373   return encode_uniqid(er->uniqid);
00374 }
00375 dfsch_object_t* dfsch_extref_ref(char* ref){
00376   extref_t* er;
00377   uint32_t uniq_id[3];
00378 
00379   if (!decode_uniqid(uniq_id, ref)){
00380     dfsch_error("extref:invalid-handle", dfsch_make_string_cstr(ref));
00381   }
00382 
00383   er = extref_get(uniq_id);
00384 
00385   if (!er){
00386     dfsch_error("extref:expired-handle", dfsch_make_string_cstr(ref));
00387   }
00388 
00389   switch(er->mode){
00390   case DFSCH_EXTREF_REFRESH:
00391     er->valid_to = er->timeout + time(NULL);
00392     break;
00393   case DFSCH_EXTREF_ONCEONLY:
00394     er->valid_to = 0;
00395     break;
00396   }
00397 
00398   return er->object;
00399 }
